tool.name: write_file
tool.description: Write content to a file, creating it if it doesn't exist or overwriting it if it does. Use this tool when you need to create new files, update configuration files, or store any text-based content.
tool.details: This tool writes the provided content to a file, completely replacing any existing content. Important notes: - If the file exists, it will be completely overwritten - Parent directories will be created automatically if they don't exist - Content should be a string - Use UTF-8 encoding for text files - Be careful with overwriting important files

parameter.name: file_path
parameter.description: Path to the file to write. Can be relative to current working directory or absolute path.

parameter.name: content
parameter.description: The content to write to the file. This will completely replace any existing file content.

returns.description: Response containing: - success: Whether the file was written successfully - message: Status message with file size info or error details - data: None

tool.examples:
# Create a new Python script
scripts/hello.py #!/usr/bin/env python3
def main(): print("Hello, World!")
if __name__ == "__main__": main()
# Write JSON configuration
config.json { "api_key": "your-key-here", "timeout": 30, "debug": false }
# Create a README file
README.md # My Project
This is a sample project.
## Installation
pip install -r requirements.txt
